thread.title: A season seven “Game of Thrones” beer is coming (10 Photos)
thread.title_full: A season seven “Game of Thrones” beer is coming (10 Photos)

author: Kayla
title: A season seven “Game of Thrones” beer is coming (10 Photos)
text:
Instagram 
The seventh season of “Game of Thrones” is set to release on July 16 and fans everywhere are rejoicing. 
One brewery is so excited about the new season they are releasing a special season seven brew to help with the stress leading up to the premiere. Brewery Ommegang is making a batch of 9% Belgian-style golden ale called “Bend the Knee” set to release around Memorial Day. It will come in 750ml bottles featuring the sigils of the Stark, Targaryen, and Lannister houses. 2 
They aren’t new to the scene though, Ommegang partned with HBO back in 2013 and they already have seven “GOT” beers in the collection. 3 
The first beer in the collection was released ahead of season three. It’s a blonde ale called Iron Throne. 4 
The Ommegang website describes Take the Black Stout as a “deep, dark and complex like those who have sworn the oath to defend Westeros against threats from the north. The label depicts the Weirwood tree where Jon Snow recited the oath before joining the Night’s Watch.” 5 
The third beer is “named after the motto of House Targaryen, Fire and Blood is inspired by Daenerys Targaryen and her three dragons, Drogon, Rhaegal and Viserion. To celebrate the rebirth of dragons, three different labels were created by the Game of Thrones visual effects specialists, each depicting one of Daenerys’ feared dragons.” Advertisement Advertisement 6 
Fans selected an Abbey Dubbel named “VALAR MORGHULIS” as the next brew with the two-headed coin on the label. 7 
The Three-Eyed Raven is saison and a dark beer. 8 
Seven Kingdoms is a mix between a traditional Belgian-style wheat and a hop-forward American ale. 9 
Valar Dohaeris is the season six beer in the series. 10
